extendedIngredients.name: whole fish
extendedIngredients.original: 8 oz whole fish (trout, orata or branzini)

title: Broiled Trout, Orata Or Branzini With Rosemary And Lemon
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Broiled Trout, Oratan Or Branzini With Rosemary And Lemon a try. This recipe serves 2 and costs $4.71 per serving. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 259 calories, 47g of protein, and 4g of fat per serving. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. 15 people have made this recipe and would make it again. If you have fish, lemon, garlic cloves, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the fresh rosemary you could follow this main course with the Vanilla Yogurt with Grape and Blueberry Compote with Honey and Fresh Rosemary: An Easy Breakfast or Dessert as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 97%, this dish is amazing. Try Broiled Steelhead Trout With Rosemary, Lemon and Garlic, Broiled Trout With Blood Orange Olive Oil & Shrimp Skewers, and Grilled Trout with Rosemary and Garlic for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Skyfall Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Skyfall Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Pale straw in color with notes of mango, citrus blossom and banana in the nose. On the palate a medley of tropical fruit unfolds into tangerine, mango, grapefruit, and banana flavors. These tropical notes continue throughout the long and lingering finish.
